headline.print_headline: Coca-Cola Will Disclose Some Research Spending
headline.main: Coca-Cola to Disclose Its Spending on Research Into Soft Drinks and Health

docs.abstract: Coca-Cola announces it will begin disclosing its investments in scientific research and advocacy about impact sugary soft drinks have on public health and obesity; move follows criticism of company for its ties to Global Energy Balance Network, nonprofit advocacy group that contends people worry too much about what they eat and not enough about how much they exercise.
docs.lead_paragraph: The company was criticized after disclosure that it had financial ties to a group that argues for less concern about eating habits and more emphasis on exercise.
docs.snippet: The company was criticized after disclosure that it had financial ties to a group that argues for less concern about eating habits and more emphasis on exercise.

headline.print_headline: Coke to Disclose Details on Its Health Efforts
headline.main: Coke to Disclose Details on Its Health Efforts

docs.lead_paragraph: Coca-Cola says it will start publishing information about its health and nutrition efforts after it was criticized for funding a group that many felt touted the company's message.
docs.snippet: Coca-Cola says it will start publishing information about its health and nutrition efforts after it was criticized for funding a group that many felt touted the company's message.

headline.print_headline: Scientists Find How Obesity Gene Works, a Clue to Treatment
headline.main: Scientists Find How Obesity Gene Works, a Clue to Treatment

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have finally figured out how the key gene tied to obesity makes people fat, a major discovery that could open the door to an entirely new approach to the problem beyond diet and exercise.
docs.snippet: Scientists have finally figured out how the key gene tied to obesity makes people fat, a major discovery that could open the door to an entirely new approach to the problem beyond diet and exercise.

headline.print_headline: Poll Finds Most Back Healthy School Meals
headline.main: Poll Finds Most Back Healthy School Meals

docs.abstract: National poll by W K Kellogg Foundation finds 86 percent of Americans support giving schoolchildren healthy meals as required by 2010 federal law on nutritional standards.
docs.lead_paragraph: According to the poll, released by the W.K. Kellogg Foundation, 86 percent of Americans support the standards required by a 2010 law, including providing more fruits and vegetables.
docs.snippet: According to the poll, released by the W.K. Kellogg Foundation, 86 percent of Americans support the standards required by a 2010 law, including providing more fruits and vegetables.

headline.print_headline: TV Report: Subway Pitchman to Admit to Child-Porn Charges
headline.main: TV Report: Subway Pitchman to Admit to Child-Porn Charges

docs.lead_paragraph: Longtime Subway pitchman Jared Fogle is expected to plead guilty to child-pornography charges, an Indiana television station reported Tuesday.
docs.snippet: Longtime Subway pitchman Jared Fogle is expected to plead guilty to child-pornography charges, an Indiana television station reported Tuesday.

headline.main: Daily Coffee May Boost Colon Cancer Survival

docs.abstract: Colon cancer patients who were heavy coffee drinkers had a far lower risk of dying or having their cancer return than those who did not drink coffee.
docs.snippet: Colon cancer patients who were heavy coffee drinkers had a far lower risk of dying or having their cancer return than those who did not drink coffee.

headline.print_headline: New Study Links Preterm Birth With Microbes in Mom's Body
headline.main: New Study Links Preterm Birth With Microbes in Mom's Body

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists might have found a new way to tell who's at risk of having a premature baby, by checking the bacterial community that lives in mom's reproductive tract.
docs.snippet: Scientists might have found a new way to tell who's at risk of having a premature baby, by checking the bacterial community that lives in mom's reproductive tract.

headline.print_headline: 2016 Hopefuls Hit the Gym, Try to Skip Pie on Campaign Trail
headline.main: 2016 Hopefuls Hit the Gym, Try to Skip Pie on Campaign Trail

docs.lead_paragraph: Scott Walker is counting steps on his FitBit. Jeb Bush swears by the Paleo diet. Bobby Jindal is a "gym rat."
docs.snippet: Scott Walker is counting steps on his FitBit. Jeb Bush swears by the Paleo diet. Bobby Jindal is a "gym rat."

docs.abstract: Download interview with David Raff, science integrity officer for United States Bureau of Reclamation, who offers recommendations for books and other forms of entertainment.
docs.lead_paragraph: A water expert on his passion for CrossFit and “So You Think You Can Dance.”
docs.snippet: A water expert on his passion for CrossFit and “So You Think You Can Dance.”
